title: How to Label the Axes of an Excel Graph

steps.title: Open your Excel document.
steps.content: Open your Excel document. Double-click an Excel document that contains a graph. If you haven't yet created the document, open Excel and click Blank workbook , then create your graph before continuing.

steps.title: Select the graph.
steps.content: Select the graph. Click your graph to select it.

steps.title: Click +.
steps.content: Click + . It's to the right of the top-right corner of the graph. This will open a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click the Axis Titles checkbox.
steps.content: Click the Axis Titles checkbox. It's near the top of the drop-down menu. Doing so checks the Axis Titles box and places text boxes next to the vertical axis and below the horizontal axis. If there is already a check in the Axis Titles box, uncheck and then re-check the box to force the axes' text boxes to appear.

steps.title: Select an "Axis Title" box.
steps.content: Select an "Axis Title" box. Click either of the "Axis Title" boxes to place your mouse cursor in it.

steps.title: Enter a title for the axis.
steps.content: Enter a title for the axis. Select the "Axis Title" text, type in a new label for the axis, and then click the graph. This will save your title. You can repeat this process for the other axis title.
